gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦਰਪਨ ਸੂਧੋ ਸੁਧ ਮੁਖ ਦੇਖੀਅਤ ੳੁਲਟ ਕੈ ਦੇਖੈ ਮੁਖ ਦੇਖੀਅੈ ਭੲਿਅਾਨ ਸੋ
transliteration: Jaisay Darapan Soodho Sudh Moukh Daykheeata , Ulat Kai Daykhai Moukh Daykheeai Bhaiaan So ?
translation: Just as the image is real when the mirror is held straight and it becomes aberrated, when the mirror is held upside down. The face looks awful.

gurmukhi: ਮਧੁਰ ਬਚਨ ਤਾਹੀ ਰਸਨਾ ਸੈ ਪ੍ਰਯਾਰੋ ਲਾਗੈ ਕੌਰਕ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਨ ਲਾਗੈ ੳੁਰ ਬਾਨ ਸੋ
transliteration: Madhur Bachan Taahee Rasanaa Sai Pyaaro Laagai , Kaurak Sabad Soun Laagai Ur Baan So ?
translation: Just as sweet words uttered by tongue feel loving to the ears, but bitter words said with the same tongue hurt like arrow.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦਾਨੋ ਖਾਤ ਗਾਤ ਪੁਸ ਮਿਸ ਸ੍ਵਾਦ ਮੁਖ ਪੋਸਤ ਕੈ ਪੀੲੇ ਦੁਖ ਬ੍ਰਯਾਪਤ ਮਸਾਨ ਸੋ
transliteration: Jaisay Daano Khaat Gaat Pous Mis Svaad Moukha , Posat Kai Peeay Doukh Byaapat Masaan So ?
translation: Just as food eaten with the mouth leaves a good taste in the mouth and if poppy extract is consumed with the same mouth, it is distressing and one gets feeling of near death.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਭ੍ਰਿਤ ਨਿੰਦਕ ਸ੍ਵਭਾਵ ਚਕੲੀ ਚਕੋਰ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਮਤ ਸਹਨਸੀਲ ਭਾਨੁ ਸੋ ||੬੪੪||
transliteration: Taisay Bhrit Nindak Svabhaav Chakaee Chakora , Satigur Samat Sahanaseel Bhaanu So ?644?
translation: Similarly, the nature of a true servant of the True Guru and a slander is like a Chakvi and Chakor (Chakvi longs for the light of the Sun while a Chakor desires setting of the Sun). The clement nature of the True Guru is like Sun that provides light to al
